intro: Mertensia arizonica var. subnuda, commonly known as Arizona bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open woodlands, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
